newsitem.title: CHINA: Shenzhen B shares fall at noon on correction.
newsitem.headline: Shenzhen B shares fall at noon on correction.

text.p: Shenzhen's hard currency B share index fell slightly during the Wednesday morning session on a technical correction after rises over the past three sessions, analysts said.
The index lost 0.90 point or 0.68 percent to 130.55 on turnover of HK$21 million.
The domestic A share index declined 1.37 points or 0.33 percent to 411.86 on turnover of 1.5 billion yuan.
"B shares fell on a technical correction," an analyst at J&A Securities (HK) said. "But the market still lacks clear direction."
Analysts said the B share index was likely to move within a narrow range in the coming sessions.
"Sharp declines in the B share market are unlikely," an analyst at China Guotai Securities said.
Guangdong Expressway was the biggest B share loser, sliding HK$0.31 or 6.80 percent to HK$4.25 on volume of 23,600 shares.

Analysts said falls in television tube maker Shenzhen SEG pressured the B share index. The stock was the morning's most active and it finished down HK$0.10 at a session low of HK$5.60 on volume of 1.3 million shares. It briefly rose to a high of HK$6.10.
The issue rose strongly earlier this week on institutional bargain hunting after its previous heavy losses, brokers said.
On the A share market, weakness in market leader Shenzhen Development Bank added to the index decline, brokers said. The issue fell 0.13 yuan to 33.97 yuan on volume of 700,740 shares.
Brokers said the share has performed poorly since the bank last month forecast slower than expected earnings growth for 1997.
